Package player

Class AbstractPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • player.AbstractPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CPUPlayer, HumanPlayer
    public abstract class AbstractPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An abstract base player. Used both to provide common functionality to the concrete players and to make use of polymorphism
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alessandro
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AbstractPlayer​(java.lang.String playerName, int boardSize)
      Constructs a new player object with the specified player name and the specified board size.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractPlayer

        public AbstractPlayer​(java.lang.String playerName,
                      int boardSize)
        Constructs a new player object with the specified player name and the specified board size. Note that the object is still not ready for use, and will require the ships to be placed.
        Parameters:
        playerName - the name of the player.
        boardSize - the size of the board.

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()
        Returns:
        the board

      • getPlayerName

        public java.lang.String getPlayerName()
        Returns:
        the playerName

      • placeShips

        public abstract void placeShips​(int[] lengths)
        Places the ships specified by the input array on the grid.
        Parameters:
        lengths - an array of integers. For every value in the array, a ship with that length will be created.
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException - if this function does not manage to place all ships (for example, if it's impossible to do so).

      • getShot

        public abstract Coordinate getShot()
        Return a shot coordinate to be fired, or null if this player wants to exit the game

      • checkFiredShot

        public ShotResults checkFiredShot​(Coordinate c)
        Returns the result of an incoming shot and keeps track of the result of that shot. Displays the result message.
        Parameters:
        c - the coordinate to fire to.

      • recordShot

        public void recordShot​(Coordinate c,
                       ShotResults result)
        Records the result of a shot at the specified coordinate.
        Parameters:
        c - coordinate that was shot at.

      • isDefeated

        public boolean isDefeated()
        Returns whether this player was defeated.
        Returns:
        true if this player was defeated, false otherwise.

      • displayGrid

        public void displayGrid()
        Displays the ship grid used by the player with reported damages.
